paragraphs: Northeast India is where the Himalayas meet the monsoons, creating landscapes that seem painted by nature herself.
For centuries, these mountains and valleys have been home to communities who understood that life and land are inseparable.
Isolation became a gift—preserving languages, crafts, and wisdom that the modern world has only begun to discover.
Today, the Northeast stands as a testament to what happens when people choose to live with nature rather than against it.

peopleSection.title: People of the Hills and Valleys
peopleSection.description: The Northeast is home to communities where the individual exists within the collective—where oral traditions carry history, where festivals mark seasons, and where every person knows the name of their land.
